title: Deon Apps
text:
Deon Apps (born 12 October 1987) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played for the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>. 
Background.
Deon Apps was born in <a href="Bega%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Bega, New South Wales</a>, Australia.
Playing career.
Apps made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a> debut during round 12 of the <a href="2011%20NRL%20season">2011 NRL season</a> against the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a>. Apps played a total of 51 games for Norths after spending a majority of his time playing in the <a href="NSW%20Cup">NSW Cup</a>.
His junior club was the <a href="Bega%20Roosters">Bega Roosters</a> and his nickname iPhone was given to him by club hooker <a href="Issac%20Luke">Issac Luke</a>. He is the older brother of Dragons, Blues and Jillaroos representative player <a href="Kezie%20Apps">Kezie Apps</a>.
